III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126: Sufficiency of Staff
Section (1) The licensee shall develop and adhere to a written staff-to-
Description resident ratio formula for direct care workers.
1

Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth A forced Youth B to kiss her and threatened her.
Investigation On 7/13/23, I spoke to consultant 1 via telephone. Allegations
were reviewed and information concerning the facility was shared.
On 7/13/23, I left a voicemail for Complainant 1. Complainant 1
did not respond to PC.
The following interviews were completed face to face at the
facility on 7/14/23:
Supervisor 1: Supervisor 1 reported the allegations came out
when Youth A accused Youth B of having her (Youth A’s babydoll)
in her bedroom and wouldn’t return it. Supervisor 1 reported that
Youth A then told her Youth B kissed her in the bathroom.
Supervisor 1 reported that Youth A told this to Staff 1 too. Staff 1
did complete a 3200 and completed an incident report. Youth A
was unable to provide a time frame on when this incident
occurred. Supervisor 1 reported that the bathrooms in the unit are
locked and must be unlocked by staff prior to usage. The doors
may stay opened once unlocked while the youth is using the
restroom. The bathroom is an open unit with stalls. When the
youth is done in the bathroom, the bathroom door is to be locked.
Staff 1: Staff 1 reported Youth A told her that Youth B forced her
to kiss her in the doorway of the bathroom. Youth A reported that
staff were sitting at the table in the unit. Youth A reported that
Youth B said, “give me a kiss or I will beat your ass.” Staff 1
reported that Youth A reported that she had to give Youth B her
baby doll or Youth B would lie and say that she (Youth A) kissed
Youth B. Staff 1 reported that only one youth can be in the
bathroom at a time. Staff 1 reported that the staff must unlock the
bathroom door for the youth to use it. Staff 1 reported that staff will
redirect youth if someone is using the bathroom and another youth
is at the entranceway of the bathroom. Staff 1 reported that if
there are more than 1 youth who need to use the restroom, the
staff will stand at the doorway to supervise. Staff 1 reported that is
would be out of the ordinary for someone to take Youth A’s baby
doll without Youth A saying something due to Youth A usually
having her baby doll with her.
Youth B: Youth B reported that Youth A gave her the baby doll
before she went to her home visit so that Youth B could take care
of her. Youth B reported that Youth A even gave her a backpack
of the babydolls belongings. Youth B reported that a couple weeks
2

ago Youth A was at the closet and asked her (Youth B) to kiss her
(Youth A). Youth B reported she did not kiss Youth A. Youth B
reported that Youth A kissed her on the lips. Youth B reported
staff were at the table and did not see her do this. Youth B
reported she did not kiss Youth A at the bathroom entranceway.
Youth B reported that staff have to unlock the bathroom door for
them to use it. Youth B reported and they usually go 1 by 1 in the
bathroom. Youth B reported sometimes they prop the bathroom
door and if there are issues in the unit, they keep the door locked.
Youth A: Youth A reported that Youth B wanted to kiss her. Youth
A reported that Youth B kissed her at the bathroom entrance.
Youth A reported that Youth B asked to use the restroom. Staff
unlocked the door to the bathroom for Youth B. Youth A reported
then she went to the bathroom entrance, and they kissed and then
she left the entranceway. Youth A reported that staff were in the
unit at the table. Youth A reported to use the bathroom, the youth
have to ask the staff to open the door. Once the youth is in the
door, they can have the bathroom door closed unless there are
some issues with the youth to keep the door opened.
Video footage was not available for this situation due being given
a specific date for the incident to have occurred. I was able to
review when Youth A gave Youth B her babydoll in the video. She
gave her the babydoll and a bag. There was no visual evidence of
bullying or forcing.
I reviewed the incident report written by Staff 1 on 7/13/23.
Youth A had stated to Staff 1 she had to give her babydoll to
Youth B because Youth B stated she would “lie on her” and tell
everyone that Youth A forced her (Youth B) to kiss her.
I observed the unit. The unit is an open area. The table (where
staff are said to be sitting) is next to an open living space, which is
next to the entrance to the bathroom. The bathroom entrance is
visible when sitting at the table and the living room area. The
bathroom door was unlocked and opened when I observed the
unit.
Analysis There is no evidence to validate Youth A and Youth B kissed at
the bathroom entrance. Youth A reported that she kissed Youth B
at the bathroom entrance, yet Youth B is stating she was kissed
by Youth A at the closet. There is no time frame to review and no
video footage to determine incident. There are no specific staff
noted by either Youth A or Youth B. Either way, both youth
reported that staff were sitting at the table in line of sight. Should
3

additional information become available this investigation will be
re-opened.
Technical Assistance: Technical Assistance was provided
concerning the bathroom policy. There were multiple procedures
laid out by staff and youth on how the bathroom is supervised
when in usage and whether the door is locked or unlocked when
not in use. It would be beneficial for the agency to review their
written policy and ensure the written policy is being practiced by
staff.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
